edu.rit.io

Class ExternalMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.io.ExternalMap<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key data type.
    V - Value data type.

    public class ExternalMap<K,V>
extends Object
    Class ExternalMap provides a mapping from keys to values, where the keys and values are stored in an external file. The key must be an object suitable for use in a hashed data structure. The value may be any object. Keys and values must not be null. Keys and values must be streamable or serializable.

    When an external map is constructed, the keys are read from the file, but the values are not. Subsequently, the get(key) method retrieves the value associated with the given key; the value is read from the file the first time it is retrieved. The add(key,value) method adds a new (key, value) mapping, which is written to the file.

    Note: Class ExternalMap is multiple thread safe.

      • get

        public V get(K key)
      throws IOException
        Get the value associated with the given key in this external map. If this external map does not contain key, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        Returns:
        Value associated with key, or null.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • add

        public void add(K key,
       V value)
         throws IOException
        Add the given key and associated value to this external map. The key and the value must not be null. The key must not already exist in this external map. The key and the value must be streamable or serializable.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        value - Value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null. Thrown if value is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key already exists in this external map.
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
